com.tambapps.android.grooidshell.chart

Class MultiLineChart

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tambapps.android.grooidshell.chart.MultiLineChart

  • public class MultiLineChart
extends Object
    A chart that can display multiple line charts

      • setTimeUnitX

        public MultiLineChart setTimeUnitX(TimeUnit timeUnitX)
        Set the time unit used to display x axis. By setting it, x values will be considered as timestamp and they will be displayed truncated to the given timeUnitX
        Parameters:
        timeUnitX - the time unit
        Returns:
        this

      • getSecondYAxisBounds

        public float[] getSecondYAxisBounds()
        Returns the optional second Y axis bounds. If set, you'll see a second Y axis displayed in the right
        Returns:
        the optional second Y axis bounds. If set, you'll see a second Y axis displayed in the right

      • setSecondYAxisBounds

        public MultiLineChart setSecondYAxisBounds(float lower,
                                           float upper)
        Sets the optional second Y axis bounds. If set, you'll see a second Y axis displayed in the right of the chart that goes from lower to upper
        Parameters:
        lower - the lower bound of the second Y axis
        upper - the upper bound of the second Y axis
        Returns:
        this line chart

      • setSecondYAxisBounds

        public MultiLineChart setSecondYAxisBounds(List<Float> secondYAxisBounds)
        Sets the optional second Y axis bounds. If set, you'll see a second Y axis displayed in the right of the chart that goes from lower to upper
        Parameters:
        secondYAxisBounds - a list of two elements containing the lower abd upper bound of the second Y axis
        Returns:
        this line chart

      • setSecondYAxisBounds

        public MultiLineChart setSecondYAxisBounds(float[] secondYAxisBounds)
        Sets the optional second Y axis bounds. If set, you'll see a second Y axis displayed in the right of the chart that goes from lower to upper
        Parameters:
        secondYAxisBounds - an array of two elements containing the lower abd upper bound of the second Y axis
        Returns:
        this line chart
